intro: Mentzelia mojavensis, commonly known as the Mojave bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, adapted to the harsh desert environment. The plant produces striking blue to purple tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mentzelia mojavensis is also known for its ability to thrive in extreme temperatures and low moisture conditions.
